title: Mourning the death of Jerome Brisman, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION mourning the death of Jerome I. Brisman, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Jerome I. Brisman, of Cornwall, New  York,  died  on  Monday,
December 27, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Jerome I. Brisman attended the United States Military Academy
at West Point and graduated in 1952; and
  WHEREAS, Jerome I. Brisman distinguished himself in his profession and
by his sincere dedication and substantial contribution to the welfare of
his community; and
  WHEREAS, President and owner of West Point Tours, Inc. for many years,
Jerome  I. Brisman greatly enjoyed working with his family of employees,
where he was lovingly known as Mr. B.; and
  WHEREAS, Jerome I. Brisman contributed greatly  to  the  promotion  of
tourism  in  the  region  of  Orange  County,  New York; in 2007, he was
awarded the Ottaway Medal in recognition of these noble accomplishments;
and
  WHEREAS, Jerome I. Brisman's commitment to excellence, and his  spirit
of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including char-
itable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Past President of the New York School Bus Contractors Associ-
ation and of Temple Beth Jacob, Jerome I. Brisman recently served on the
board  of  the  Orange  County  Citizens  Foundation,  where he fostered
relationships that brought him great joy; and
  WHEREAS, A great provider to his family, Jerome I. Brisman continually
gave of himself to ensure others' happiness; he was a true gentleman who
always greeted you with a smile; he was a courageous person who  led  by
example and will be greatly missed; and
  WHEREAS,  Jerome  I.  Brisman is survived by his best friend and wife,
Gloria Brisman and their four loving children, Judith,  Jeffrey,  Robert
and Jay as well as his nine adoring grandchildren; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, Jerome I.  Brisman  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Jerome I. Brisman, distinguished citizen and  devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Jerome I. Brisman.
